page.title: 05AGRICULTURE - FARM CROPS
page.content: FARMS Most farms in the area are tenanted.They lie about 200-250 feet above sea level between the rivers Forth and Teith. CROPS- Mainly barley is grown with an odd field of oats or wheat. September is the main harvest month. Combine harvesters are used & grain sold to Agricultural Merchants hope- fully for malting, for brewing and distilling. The straw is baled and used for feeding and bedding cattle. Some hay is grown too for feeding cattle and sheep. This is usually baled but due to unseasonable weather this year the hay has been made into silage.Most farms grow some acreage of potatoes. The ground is usually let to Potato Merchants. The farmer ploughs the ground and the merchant does the rest of the work including harvesting. Some turnips are grown to fatten lambs
